title: Sex Discrimination Case in Hawaii Could Change High School Sports Across the U.S.
description: It is rare for Title IX cases to go to trial. In Hawaii, a looming case could be a landmark stress test for the 50-year-old law.
dc:creator: David W. Chen
media:credit: Marie Eriel Hobro for The New York Times
media:description: Ashley Badis played water polo at James Campbell High School, but her team’s season was jeopardized because the school didn’t hire a coach. Her dad stepped in.
